author: P V Srividya
text:
(from left) VCK leader Thol. Thirumavalavan, MDMK chief Vaiko, and State secretary CPI(M)G. Ramakrishnan at a public meeting in Krishnagiri on Wednesday. - Photo: N.Bashkaran

Different constituents of the People’s Welfare Front (PWF) came together here promising to provide an alternative to two major Dravidian parties and a government free from corruption.

VCK leader Thol.Thirumavalavan said, “Only now is the time ripe for a third alliance with people’s desire for change.” Promising to ring in “fundamental change”, the VCK leader urged the public to vote for the alliance, “This is an alliance for the future and will not end after elections.”

G.Ramakrishnan, State Secretary, CPI(M), said there was no difference between the two Dravidian parties on the lines of policies or principles.

Both the AIADMK and the DMK were of the same make, on corruption, economic policies or issues of social justice, he said.

MDMK chief and the alliance convenor Vaiko drubbed the DMK and AIADMK for their policies and the PMK for practising caste politics. HE questioned how the DMK had agreed to both the Coal Bed Methane project and the GAIL pipeline project, and lashed out at the AIADMK for justifying continuance of Tasmac’s for the revenue.

R.Mutharasan, State Secretary, CPI, alleged that all three parties, AIADMK, DMK and the PMK were accused of corruption, while not a finger could be pointed on any of the parties of People’s Welfare Front.

This is an alliance for the future and will not end after elections: Thol. Thirumavalavan
title: People’s Welfare Front promises corruption-free government
